intro: Conicosia pulliloba, commonly known as the slender conicosia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a smooth texture. Conicosia pulliloba is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth areas.
